# children

**Instance Property**

The child entities that the entity manages.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @preconcurrency var children: Entity.ChildCollection { get set }
```

## Discussion

An entity can have any number of child entities.

Use the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/HasHierarchy/addChild(_:preservingWorldTransform:)] method to add a child to an entity. Use the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/HasHierarchy/removeChild(_:preservingWorldTransform:)] method to remove one from an entity. These methods automatically update the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/HasHierarchy/parent] properties of the child entities.

## Managing children

- **addChild(_:preservingWorldTransform:)**: Adds the given entity to the collection of child entities.
- **removeChild(_:preservingWorldTransform:)**: Removes the given child from the entity.
